titleStmt.title: A survey of the law. Containing directions how to prosecute and defend personal actions, usually brought at common law. With the judges opinions in several cases. To which is annexed, the nature of a writ of error, and the general proceedings thereupon. With a plain table for the easy finding out of every particular. / By Wiliam Glisson and Anthony Gulston [brace] Esquires, [brace] baristers at law.
Common law epitomiz'd
titleStmt.author: Glisson, William.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Brome, at the Gun in Ivy-Lane, and Thomas Basset in St. Dunstans Church-yard.,

notesStmt.note: Later editions published as: The common law epitomiz'd.

Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
